intro: Polybotrya nieuwenhuisii, commonly known as the Cape mountain hakea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive floral morphology. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with showy bracts that attract pollinators. It is a shrub or small tree, often found in the fynbos biome.
